Exercises - On the Lengths of the Sub-tangent and Sub-normal: also Beam Problems.
1. Find the lengths of the sub-tangent and sub-tangent of the curve.
If y = x², where x = 1, find the slope of the curve in 1.
2. A quadrature has the radius of 3 ft and a rise of 8 ft. At what point is the tangent at the end?
3. The equation of the tangent to the curve y = \frac{1}{x} is  y - 2 = 450.
In Exercise 5, consider X is at a distance along the Shining Floor, and the Shining Floor forms an angle of θ with a horizontal run.
The beam is supported at both ends, and loaded continuously with w per ft.
